intro: Burdachia prismatocarpa var. loretoensis, commonly known as the Loreto burdachia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure with thick, ribbed stems that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming during the dry season. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. This species is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central America, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
